channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: England flags affixed to lampposts near local Mosque, 29th August
item.description:
On Crayford High Street (on the hill) large England flags have been attached to lampposts. These are all in the area of a large Mosque (Masjid Abu Bakar). It doesn't take much imagination to figure out that this is to intimidate local people who use this as a place of worship. I only noticed them this morning (Friday 29th August).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Crayford High Street, Crayford, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain smell, 29th August
item.description:
I have been able to smell an unpleasant smell for the last few weeks, possibly sewage. It seems to be coming from near my house. I have checked my drains and do not think it is coming from them. Could the council please check the shared sewage pipes ?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lansdowne Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken planters, 29th August
item.description:
At the end of goldsmiths road SE15, planters were put in when an LTN zone was created. these planters were only a temporary measure but have not been replaced with proper permanent road furniture, as for instance they were in nearby Fenham Av. They are now falling apart and very much an eyesore as well as a potential hazard for pedestrians and cyclists. could a proper solution be put in place

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 136, Meeting House Lane, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not acceptable to leave rubbish, 29th August
item.description:
Previous response unacceptable!!! Not prepared to have this level of rubbish left across the street. It's a hazard, it will attract vermin and it's irresponsible of the council to suggest this will just get cleaned in the next scheduled clean. When is that? What is the time scale?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 466, Green Lane, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped car 11 months!, 29th August
item.description:
I have reported this car to you twice I have been in touch with the police and they have said to get back in touch with you with and give you my ref no: RAV-1232-0101-04 They have said it’s you that needs to sort this out It has been dumped for 11 months ! It’s been broken into and now looks an eye saw ! Why a should we put up with this! It’s a wreck
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horsfeld Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet
